Flub.Name: Headwaters
Flub.Description: The number of headwaters from which rivers can start. Not all will become rivers, but rather tributaries that feed the main river.

Flub.Name: Water
Flub.Description: The amount of water in headwaters. Higher values can create larger rivers.

Flub.Name: Width
Flub.Description: The width of the rivers. High values create wide rivers, with somewhat wide tributaries. Low values create thin rivers with thin tributaries.

Flub.Name: Depth
Flub.Description: The depth of the rivers. This value is independent of Downcutting.

Flub.Name: Downcutting
Flub.Description: Like with the Erosion node, Downcutting decides how deeply the river should cut into rock and soil while moving forward.

Flub.Name: Render water surface
Flub.Description: Create a water surface for the rivers. This can be used directly in the terrain, especially when you have wide rivers, or export it as a separate heightmap for further river production in your CG application or game engine.

Flub.Name: Seed
Flub.Description: The randomization pattern or seed for the node's process.
